bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 114 (Tuesday, July 12, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SWALWELL:H.R. 8340.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, of the United States Constitution,specifically Clause 18 (relating to the power to make alllaws necessary and proper for carrying out the powers vestedin congress).[Page H5975]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Educator Down Payment Assistance Act of 2022

This bill requires the Department of Education to award grants for assisting certain elementary and secondary school educators with the purchase of a first home (e.g., by providing direct down payment costs). Entities eligible for the grants include local governments, state housing finance agencies, and local educational agencies.

bill.title: Educator Down Payment Assistance Act of 2022

item.title: Educator Down Payment Assistance Act of 2022
Educator Down Payment Assistance Act of 2022
To direct the Secretary of Education to award grants to provide financial assistance to certain educators to make down payments on certain homes, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
